spec.name: Midnight Mqila
spec.description: Midnight Mqila (M'qila de Minuit) refers to stalls or venues specializing in 'mqila' (a hot, savory stew or slow-cooked meat dish, often eaten with bread) that are particularly popular late at night or around midnight. This type of street food vendor caters to the late-night social scene and represents a distinctive part of Casablanca's nocturnal culinary culture, offering filling, traditional meals after other restaurants have closed.

access.comment: Typically operates during evening and late-night hours.
